storyInfo: Outcast arrives at County Hillock. At the Rhodes Island branch office, she gets to know the barracks' guard of honor, Jane.

attributes.content: 7:11 A.M. \ Overcast
Rhodes Island County Hillock Branch Office
Morning, everyone! The weather's not bad at all today, wouldn't you say, Uncle Oliver?
attributes.name: Janie

attributes.content: Oh, it's you. I was just asking, who else could it be knocking at the crack of dawn? But it's a gloomy day today no matter where you look. What's to appreciate?
attributes.name: Operator Oliver

attributes.content: Any time it's not raining is good weather. That's what you get in County Hillock. For that matter, how do you know the day's not going to turn clear skies?
attributes.name: Janie

attributes.content: Fine, you've got me there. Shredder, you stop dilly-dallying. We haven't got anyone dropping in, it's just Janie, daily ditcher.
attributes.name: Operator Oliver

attributes.content: You're one to talk. Shredder, you come over here with us.
attributes.name: Janie

attributes.content: I brought you a yuccoffee pie today, and some shortbread. Da sent me some tea last week, so I've brought that too. Uncle Oliver, is there any evaporated milk left?
attributes.name: Janie

attributes.content: Leftovers started molding ages ago. That bloody man—never remembers to go buy any.
attributes.name: Operator Shredder

attributes.content: Isn't it your turn on the shopping? Or am I hallucinating, somehow?
attributes.name: Operator Oliver

attributes.content: Fred! Will! We need your thoughts too!
attributes.name: Operator Oliver

attributes.content: Alright, alright, it's not worth crying over this little spilled milk. Look, what's this? Fresh new evaporated, and some cheese too. Picked them up along the way from the morning market. Here, you can have them.
attributes.name: Janie

attributes.content: Hee-hee, I've wanted to try making milk tea for forever now. I think you'll like it at least, Uncle Oliver.
attributes.name: Janie

attributes.content: Ah, still no one more considerate than you, Janie. Will, you'd better learn well. At least don't start acting like that man next to you with Shredder for a codename.
attributes.name: Operator Oliver

attributes.content: This shortbread tastes delicious... ooh, right, Miss Willow, isn't your senior officer going to get on your case for running here every day to bring us breakfast?
attributes.name: Operator Will

attributes.content: The Victorian Army's rules are a fair deal strict, if I recall.
attributes.name: Operator Shredder

attributes.content: Ah... you don't need to worry about that. I'm a guard of honor, I'm only good for big events or recruitment drives. They don't have much use to put me to—the Sergeant Major wouldn't even think about me most of the time.
attributes.name: Janie

attributes.content: Besides, it's not like I don't do anything proper.
attributes.name: Janie

attributes.content: Every morning when I get up, the first thing I do is pull this banner off its support.
attributes.name: Janie

attributes.content: While I wait for the flour to ferment and the coffee to brew, I'll straighten out the creases bit by bit.
attributes.name: Janie

attributes.content: Once the shortbread's done, that means I have to wash the flour off me. It takes time for my hair to dry naturally, and that's the perfect time to care for the flagpole, and let it shine like brand new.
attributes.name: Janie

attributes.content: Uncle Oliver, don't rush to pick up your tea yet—it's still too hot.
attributes.name: Janie

attributes.content: For a complete morning, everything needs to glow gorgeous, no exceptions. Only then can I bring joy to you all—that's my life's creed.
attributes.name: Janie

attributes.content: What's the pie like today, Shredder? Want any more?
attributes.name: Janie

attributes.content: Perfect... Just like every day before.
attributes.name: Operator Shredder

attributes.content: Really? Let me try some too... seems I put a little too much sugar in. I'll make sure to watch out for that tomorrow.
attributes.name: Janie

attributes.content: Well, I'm not going to tell you off for being lazy like they do now, Miss Willow.
attributes.name: Operator Will

attributes.content: —Janie. That's what everyone calls me.
attributes.name: Janie

attributes.content: Alright, er... Miss Jane. My honest fear's that they'll want me spending every morning as amply as you do.
attributes.name: Operator Will

attributes.content: No need for that. I'm not like any of you, there's only so much I can do for the people here. Hm... I think the tea's about the right temperature now. Just make sure to stir it a little before you drink—
attributes.name: Janie

attributes.content: Yagh!
attributes.name: Janie

attributes.content: You sent the ball flyin' again, Craig!
attributes.name: Anxious Child A

attributes.content: I'll go get it.
attributes.name: Craig

attributes.content: Oh, poo... it went in the building.
attributes.name: Anxious Child A

attributes.content: If you actually hit any of the grown-ups, then, then you're in for it! Last time, didn't Carol get...
attributes.name: Anxious Child A

attributes.content: *Huff*, *huff*... Someone's come out, let's run!
attributes.name: Anxious Child A

attributes.content: Uh...
attributes.name: Craig

attributes.content: Whose ball is this?
attributes.name: Janie

attributes.content: Um...
attributes.name: Craig

attributes.content: Is it yours?
attributes.name: Janie

attributes.content: Craig... Craig, come on, run! Forget the ball...
attributes.name: Anxious Child A

attributes.content: No... that ball's left by my da...
attributes.name: Craig

attributes.content: If you're too shy about it, I won't hand it back. Come on, hold your hand out.
attributes.name: Janie

attributes.content: Are... Are you gonna beat me?
attributes.name: Craig

attributes.content: Why would I beat you, now?
attributes.name: Janie

attributes.content: Your clothes got dirty.
attributes.name: Craig

attributes.content: Eh, that's just me being careless. It's no matter.
attributes.name: Janie

attributes.content: All the other grown-ups like you, they don't care if it wasn't me who got them dirty.
attributes.name: Craig

attributes.content: They always beat us. But not with their hands, they kick us instead. And they shout all loud, to scare us off.
attributes.name: Craig

attributes.content: *Sigh*.
attributes.name: Janie

attributes.content: That means they're definitely not your friends.
attributes.name: Janie

attributes.content: Do you live around here? I think I've spotted you before. Doesn't your ma sell apples at the crack of every dawn, down the alley in District Seventeen nearby?
attributes.name: Janie

attributes.content: Your family's apples are scrumptious. Not too crisp, but still very, very sweet. Perfect for making apple butter and spreading onto bread.
attributes.name: Janie

attributes.content: How about this? I'll put the ball on the windowsill here, and you come pick it up, okay?
attributes.name: Janie

attributes.content: Eh?
attributes.name: Janie

attributes.content: Hold on, slow down, I've got tea on my hands, it's gotten your hair all wet. Let me wipe that for you.
attributes.name: Janie

attributes.content: Um...
attributes.name: Craig

attributes.content: I'm Janie. What's your name?
attributes.name: Janie

attributes.content: Craig! It's your ma lookin' for you. Quick, you've gotta go!
attributes.name: Anxious Child A

attributes.content: Got into a commotion outside?
attributes.name: Operator Oliver

attributes.content: Children playing ball.
attributes.name: Janie

attributes.content: Those bunch of rotters, all higgledy-piggledly in the street first thing in the morning. I bet it was them who broke that last windowpane, too.
attributes.name: Operator Oliver

attributes.content: Haha... children, you know? I broke the man next door's flowerpots when I was young, and my da really gave me a talking-to for that.
attributes.name: Janie

attributes.content: You laid hands on that boy.
attributes.name: Operator Shredder

attributes.content: Just now? Yeah, if I didn't wipe his hair clean, it'd be sticky all day.
attributes.name: Janie

attributes.content: His father passed away, half a year ago. Poor bloke, caught Oripathy.
attributes.name: Operator Shredder

attributes.content: There's a lot—'cause of that—won't dare touch him.
attributes.name: Operator Shredder

attributes.content: Oh...
attributes.name: Janie

attributes.content: Workers, fairly strapped for cash. That Oriron byproduct processing plant has a partnership, with Aneca. But they don't give the full amount of prophylactics.
attributes.name: Operator Shredder

attributes.content: It's normal for you—to hesitate. In their neighborhood, it's about one in five houses, turning out to have Oripathy patients.
attributes.name: Operator Shredder

attributes.content: They care for another, in a sense. If those soldiers weren't here...
attributes.name: Operator Shredder

attributes.content: Shredder! You've lost track.
attributes.name: Operator Oliver

attributes.content: It's alright... you're just stating the facts. I've heard how... my coworkers treat the Oripathy-sick... no, not just the sick, they've got the wrong idea about all of the residents.
attributes.name: Janie

attributes.content: I... I don't think the same way. We're all Victorians, aren't we? Their days might be hard on them, I—I understand full well. But I hope for them to live a little happier too.
attributes.name: Janie

attributes.content: What do you think... Should I have been even better to that child?
attributes.name: Janie

attributes.content: ...Don't force yourself.
attributes.name: Operator Shredder

attributes.content: What's the long faces for? I'll bring the playing cards out. Wasn't it you who suggested a spot of tea with cards, Miss Jane?
attributes.name: Operator Will

attributes.content: Yes. Will's right, the sun's poking out for once in a while. Let's not waste the good weather.
attributes.name: Janie

attributes.content: Take a seat, everyone. I'll pour you all some more tea; there's still plenty left in the pot.
attributes.name: Janie

attributes.content: Is that me who's won again?
attributes.name: Operator Will

attributes.content: It's too early to be full of yourself. You're on shift tonight.
attributes.name: Operator Oliver

attributes.content: What? How's it me again?!
attributes.name: Operator Will

attributes.content: Not clicking? That was our stakes! Whoever won at cards is on broom duty, file sorting, buying us all afternoon tea...
attributes.name: Operator Oliver

attributes.content: Can I get a redeal?
attributes.name: Operator Will

attributes.content: Uncle Oliver, your jokes are putting Will in tears again.
attributes.name: Janie

attributes.content: Isn't that the fun of a game of cards? Ha-ha-ha-ha!
attributes.name: Operator Oliver

attributes.content: One small tip—next time you try second dealing, remember to watch behind you.
What—?! Who's talking?
attributes.name: Operator Oliver

attributes.content: And on a side note, the tea's an excellent brew.
attributes.name: Outcast

attributes.content: H—Hello! Who might you be?
attributes.name: Janie

attributes.content: (She came in suddenly, and none of us noticed her...)
attributes.name: Janie

attributes.content: They call me Outcast, my young Vouivran beauty.
attributes.name: Outcast

attributes.content: I'm sorry I tasted your tea without asking. Seeing as I rushed all the way over here, I hope you won't mind too much.
attributes.name: Outcast

attributes.content: F... Feel—feel free. If you haven't eaten breakfast yet, would you like to try some pie I baked? It might be a little sweet...
attributes.name: Janie

attributes.content: I'd love to. Everybody who knows me knows I love sweets—especially the Victorian kind. You got it baked like this to fancy, adorable perfection.
attributes.name: Outcast

attributes.content: Haha... Thank you for the encouragement, Lady Outcast.
attributes.name: Janie

attributes.content: —Outcast. Nobody calls me a Lady, really. I'm more of that 'Lass' type.
attributes.name: Outcast

attributes.content: I—I know who you are! I remember now... Will! C-Clean the table up, quick—
attributes.name: Operator Oliver

attributes.content: I thought you'd be here two days later... Last message, you said you'd just passed the border.
attributes.name: Operator Shredder

attributes.content: Couldn't help it, I haven't been to Victoria in a decade. Some parts are a bit more crowded, but just like me, the years are starting to show in a few places.
attributes.name: Outcast

attributes.content: If I hadn't hitched a ride the wrong way in County Peninsula, we would've met last night.
attributes.name: Outcast

attributes.content: *cough* Ahem, your understanding, please. County Hillock's not the biggest spot on the map, and we rarely get elite operators at our branch office here.
attributes.name: Operator Oliver

attributes.content: Last time I was out near Minos on field work, I met Stormeye—that was two years ago, already.
attributes.name: Operator Oliver

attributes.content: Elite operator? Just the name sounds like a force to be reckoned with.
attributes.name: Janie

attributes.content: —Rhodes Island gives different work to different people, that's all. Besides, I'm pretty much just a civil servant now. I only came to County Hillock to fetch some data.
attributes.name: Outcast

attributes.content: You're too modest.
attributes.name: Operator Oliver

attributes.content: On the topic of data, did you want to see our finance forms first, or the ledger for our inventory in/out and stock this half... (Hints to Will)
attributes.name: Operator Oliver

attributes.content: Hold your beasties.
attributes.name: Outcast

attributes.content: We're not THAT pressed for time. No need to hurl a starving girl like me straight into work. It's only fair to let me steal a breather here and there, right?
attributes.name: Outcast

attributes.content: Haha... I can sympathize greatly.
attributes.name: Janie

attributes.content: Hope I haven't disrupted your little R&R here.
attributes.name: Outcast

attributes.text: Outcast casually picks up a card. Thin, no more than paper, it spins three times and a half at her fingertips, then is gone in a swish.

attributes.content: Wow! Where'd that card just go?
attributes.name: Janie

attributes.content: Right here.
attributes.name: Outcast

attributes.content: It's back! What kind of marvelous spatial Arts is this?
attributes.name: Janie

attributes.content: Just a little sleight of hand. I've got this gloomy-looking friend who taught me. Whenever I want you concentrating on my fingertips, this method works wonders.
attributes.name: Outcast

attributes.content: All a little more relaxed now? Please, sit down, Oliver, and Shredder, Will, plus you there, kiddo, standing in the corner—you must be Fred.
attributes.name: Outcast

attributes.content: Put that folder down, and enjoy a little break with us. A chance like this doesn't come every day.
attributes.name: Outcast

attributes.content: A... Are you sure this is okay?
attributes.name: Operator Fred

attributes.content: Or would you like to see a magic trick where in ten minutes, this haggard stranger from out of town dies of boredom?
attributes.name: Outcast

attributes.content: *cough* Let's sit.
attributes.name: Operator Oliver

attributes.content: Please, continue.
attributes.name: Outcast

attributes.content: As for me, I still want a proper taste of this fine black tea with evaporated milk, and that sweet, scrumptious pie.
attributes.name: Outcast

attributes.content: Ah, there's more shortbread left here, if you still feel hungry, that is...
attributes.name: Janie

attributes.content: Thank you.
attributes.name: Outcast

attributes.content: Ahh, now this dessert hit the spot. My stomach hasn't been this happy in a while. My tongue was beginning to really miss flavor.
attributes.name: Outcast

attributes.content: Now, you, cute little miss—
attributes.name: Outcast

attributes.content: I—I'm Jane, Jane Willow.
attributes.name: Janie

attributes.content: That's a lovely name. I'm gonna guess you're old enough to drink?
attributes.name: Outcast

attributes.content: I've long since been of age, La... Lass.. Outcast. I'm serving, after all.
attributes.name: Janie

attributes.content: Oh? That gray Victorian military uniform sure falls flat under your shimmering blonde hair. Oliver, count yourself lucky. No matter how dull and cloudy it gets, you've always got your sunshine indoors.
attributes.name: Outcast

attributes.content: Haha... true, true. Little Janie's brought us a mound of happy days.
attributes.name: Operator Oliver

attributes.content: Listen to you, Uncle Oliver. You're the ones all kindly letting me in while I've snuck off from the barracks.
attributes.name: Janie

attributes.content: I was actually a tiny bit surprised, seeing you get along as well as you do—
attributes.name: Outcast

attributes.content: Jane, if all Victorian soldiers were as lovable as you, we'd lose at least half of those awful rumors making their way across our world.
attributes.name: Outcast

attributes.content: Thank you, if I haven't misunderstood. I assume those are compliments...
attributes.name: Janie

attributes.content: Even on my way here, I saw some not-so-pretty sights. But anyhow, that's not gonna dampen the joy of meeting all of you here.
attributes.name: Outcast

attributes.content: I'm very glad... I could meet you too!
attributes.name: Janie

attributes.content: Well, then, a toast to our encounter?
attributes.name: Outcast

attributes.content: I came here in kind of a hurry, so I could only bring some regular old gin, with way too much lemon because that's how I like it. You folks might find it too sour—
attributes.name: Outcast

attributes.content: We don't really drink... on work hours.
attributes.name: Operator Shredder

attributes.content: You killjoy!
attributes.name: Operator Oliver

attributes.content: Alright, that's on me for being sloppy. As a Rhodes Island Operator, I can't be an exception. Let's just have some tea.
attributes.name: Outcast

attributes.content: So—who's dealing next?
attributes.name: Outcast

attributes.content: M—Me.
attributes.name: Operator Will

attributes.content: Need a little blessing from a Sankta?
attributes.name: Outcast
